column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been taking 300mg of Bupropion XL (the generic form of Wellbutrin XL) for four years and I have to say this medicine has saved my life. Before I started Bupropion
column3: I had had five depressive episodes in four years; I have not had a depressive episode since I began taking Bupropion four years ago. I can feel happy again and I can laugh. I am able to feel sadness
column4: but it doesn't overwhelm me. I am not drowning in self-loathing anymore. I am myself again and I have been myself for four years. As far as negative side-effects are concerned
column5: I will have a migraine if I accidentally skipped a dose the day before. It also took a while to kick in. The first two weeks were difficult because my brain would go ""offline"" in the afternoon and I wouldn't be able to do anything until my brain ""restarted"" later in the evening. This pattern lasted for a few weeks. The first month was pretty terrible
column6: though there were glimmers that things were changing; I would feel less awful than usual for ten minutes every few days. The second month was a little better; I was able to feel happy for an entire hour one day and could generally enjoy things more. Week nine was when I had five whole good days where I could feel happy any time I wanted all day long. Week ten was when everything took off and I started feeling like myself again. Four years later
column7: this medication still works for me. I have been able to get back on my feet and rebuild my life after my depression because the chemicals in my brain are working for me and not against me. I feel good. I can feel good whenever I want. I'm not held captive by depression anymore. Bupropion made all of that possible."

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$"I have been dealing with depression so long that it is a mainstay in my daily life.  The depression feeds into my anxiety.  I am a low starting dose.  I am concerned about my blood pressure
column3: but it hasn't noticably risen.  Part of my issue may have been working remotely with little to no human interaction whilst my better half goes to work.  That said
column4: I am not as anxious these days.  I even started traveling for business again and it is painless!  I feel the need to exercise somewhat regularly again!  I sweated two days in a row and actually jogged on the treadmill! I can't say that I have lost any appreciable weight
column5: but I feel ""lighter"" in mood and actually want to do things.  I may have incorrectly attributed my depression to being an introvert and vice versa.  I do really like people even thought they (except for really good friends) drain my energy reserves."

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I was suicidal (didn't want to wake up

column5: couldn't eat

column19: and typing is also feeling kind of weird
column20: so this is the first time i've felt uncomfortable about a side effect.  If it worsens I would start to consider changing it up
column21: but that of course is an upsetting thing to have to deal with and invite that kind of chaos and darkness back into my life now that i'm finally getting on track after wasting months laying in bed.  Hope you guys are doing well.

column1: 11$Condition: Depression$4/2/2017 3:22:13 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$3$2$3$I'm currently taking 450mg. Each increase in dosage was beneficial for about a week
column2: but then I'd hit a plateau. 450 seemed to be the right dose for about 3 weeks
column3: but I've been on this dose for 8 weeks now and feel like the cons are starting to outweigh the pros. I'm not as focused anymore
column4: in fact I've began to have more apathy. My depression hasn't really been helped and I have emotional panic attacks now and then
column5: especially if I drink alcohol-which I was told was the equivalent to completely skipping a dose..makes sense. I've lost 5 lbs
column6: and I'm not binge eating when I feel low
column7: but now I'm obsessed with the weight loss and feel like that's equally problematic. I am less impulsive
column8: but now I seem more obsessive than normal. I've had multiple surgeries in the past 2 years and I was developing a narcotic addiction
column9: within 2 days of taking this medication that craving went completely away
column10: but my ruminating thoughts are increasing again and the impulse to take a pill for no reason but to feel numb is coming back. I take this along with Lamictal
column11: I've been on Lamictal for 3 years
column12: but it wasn't helping with my depression that I cycle with every 6 weeks. I'm ready to get off of this medication
column13: especially since I notice an increase of negative behavior during my menstrual cycle and I'm a week away from another one.

column1: I have been on Wellbutrin XL 300mg for about 2.5 years with extremely positive results. This is the first antidepressant I have ever taken
column2: and I have been much better on it. No more falling through emotional thin ice 20+ times a day
column3: no more crying
column4: and hardly any negative thinking. Started on 150xl for about 1.5-2 months then up to 300XL.

column1: In the first months experienced almost no side effects save for a few strange new headaches a couple days
column2: but they quickly went away. Only side effect is constipation
column3: which can mostly be mitigated with fiber and good eating.

column1: I take it in the morning and it has not affected my sleep
column2: though I find I do sleep better and am more refreshed when I occasionally take valerian or even a melatonin/benadryl.

column1: Last year I felt while I was doing well
column2: but still needed a little umpf to push ahead. Tried the 450mg xl and it was fine for a few days/ a week but proved to be too strong; I felt angry
column3: emotional rollercoaster started again
column4: and couldnât' focus or concentrate. Back down to 300 and all is well. Cost for brand name is outrageous. From my research decided to stay away from generics
column5: and found a reliable pharmacy to order from for a fraction of the local pharmacy cost.

column1: Exercise is still a must for me to feel O.K.   Not more than 2 days without of I fall back into a slump. Gym used to make me go from a -6 to maybe a 1-3.  Now I go from feeling a 3 to a 9/10 after the gym. "

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am a 47 year old male diagnosed with ADHD combined with bouts of major depression. Over the years I have tried every tricyclic
column3: SSRI
column4: SNRI and atypical antidepressant on the market. While I was taking Ritalin or Dexedrine I never experienced the dpression but I decided that I wanted to go medication-free for my ADHD. I question the wisdom of that decision but anyhow my doctor suggested we try Wellbutrin and I agreed. I started by taking 150mg first thing in the morning and then 300mg every morning since then. It's been about 5 months now and I can't believe the change in how I feel! Wellbutrin lifted me out of the depression right away (ie within 2 days) and it helps with the ADHD symptoms as well. Not to the same extent as the stimulants but it's enough that I can focus now and get tasks completed. I am so thankful for whoever invented bupropion. One think I noticed is that it is closely related to amphetamine and diethylpropion
column5: both used in the past as anti-depressants/anorectics. I believe it is this similarity that gives Wellbutrin the edge over the SSRI's (which are garbage in my opinion)currently in use and I would not hesitate to recommend Wellbutrin
column6: Wellbutrin SR or XL to anyone who is suffering the debilitating symptoms of depression! Two thumbs up for Wellbutrin!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$5$"As an antidepressant
column3: it worked wonders within the first week
column4: as the dose was being titrated up.  I had energy and experienced needed weight loss and was very pleased
column5: as I did not do well on SSRI or SNRIs.  Unfortunately
column6: I was not aware that I had a low seizure threshold and by the second week
column7: I had a 15 minute duration grand mal seizure and resulting head trauma.  Therefore
column8: the medication had to be discontinued.

column1: For individuals NOT prone to seizures
column2: I think this drug could be very useful
column3: but I do think extreme caution should be taken when prescribing to anyone
column4: even is there is no known history of seizure
column5: and it is imperative that front office staff be educated on signs of impending seizure.

column1: I called the doctor's office to report very uncomfortable side effects that seemed to come on rather quickly (tremor
column2: severe ringing in the ears started overnight during second week of therapy and increased dose) and was told by the receptionist that they couldn't see me that day and ""might be able to work me in the next day""
column3: and to not stop the medication until I spoke to the doctor.  After I hung up the phone
column4: I immediately had my seizure.  I don't know if the agitation of their lack of care brought it on
column5: or if it would have happened at that moment anyway
column6: but I learned to be more insistent with medical staff members after this experience.

column2: overall
column3: a wonderful alternative to SSRI and SNRI meds
column4: but not enough education is provided to the staff at many medical offices and a 'warning sign checklist' needs to be in the patient file whenever this medication is prescribed."

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$It works
55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been using Wellbutrin XL 300mg for about 5 years. Prior to it
column3: I was using SSRI type antidepressants. I would recommend anyone with mild depression
column4: which what I have
column5: to try this  first. All the SSRI types caused me to gain weight
column6: feel drowsy during the day
column7: low energy and killed my libido.  Or it did mine. Ladies
column8: if your husband has lost interest in sex while on SSRI's
column9: it is not you. It is the drug. And I would still have bouts with depression. The Wellbutrin XL has none of the above side effects. It's almost the reverse and worked just as good for me as all the newest SSRI meds. Getting off SSRI's can be tough. They have some known withdrawal symptoms. column1:
80$Condition: Depression$1/16/2014 12:08:01 PM$Reviewer: Katherine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I initially started Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day (150 mg twice per day) in 2005 along with Celexa at 20 mg due to depression and anxiety. I eventually stopped taking Wellbutrin when my Celexa dose was increased to 60 mg which appeared to be the right dose/medication for me. I was recently reduced to 40 mg of Celexa due to new studies that no more than 40 mg should be taken due to risk of heart issues/death. I am now back on Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day due to the decreased dosage of Celexa. Wellbutrin has worked for me. Side effects included decreased appetite, a little weight loss initially and dry mouth. I am a smoker and I thought Wellbutrin might help with that too, however, I did not notice any decrease in cigarette cravings while on Wellbutrin. The only thing I STRONGLY caution is do not EVER take more than your prescribed amount of Wellbutrin. I overdosed by accident (took 600 mg in one day) about 2 years after I started taking it, it was the worst experience of my life. Hallucinations, paranoia, insomnia....I literally thought I was dead and everyone around me was a ghost. I ended up going to the ER because of it (I actually thought my dead body was at the hospital and I wanted to go there to wake myself up). NEVER, EVER overdose on this medication. You will be sorry! But again, taken as prescribed, I am pleased with it. 
81$Condition: Depression$1/11/2014 10:49:51 AM$Reviewer: RxLisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been taking Wellbutrin XL 300 mg for about 5 weeks now (started on 150 mg).  This has been much more effective than any other antidepressant I've taken.  In the past 20 years I've been on Prozac, Celexa, Zoloft (with and without Abilify) and also Deplin.  The first couple of weeks, I was a bit more irritable, but was ok with it, because I cared about things again and was engaging again in life.  I was mostly irritated at how I had let everything go because I just didn't care or have the energy to do anything.  In the last couple of weeks, I have developed neck pain, headaches, and intermittently blurry vision, which all are listed possible side effects.  It's working so well for my depression at this point that I'm willing to wait a couple of months to see if the side effects go away.  I'm not sure if I've lost weight, but I'm cooking more often and eating less.  With all the other meds I've tried, it was the other way around.  All medications have side effects, these, for me are tolerable to be able to enjoy my young children and actually enjoy life again.  Before Wellbutrin, I was just kind of dragging myself through life.  I've had depression pretty much my entire adult life and tried it with and without antidepressants.  So far, With Wellbutrin XL, I feel like myself again for the first time in a very long time.

With Wellbutrin I am back to being myself.  I'm not constantly worrying about anything and everything. I'm not dragging myself through every day. Suddenly grocery shopping or pumping gas is no big deal again. I'm able to think more clearly at work. I'm actually planning a vacation which, one month ago and for the past few years, would have seemed like climbing Mount Everest.  I'm just back to being me.  No better, no worse.  I haven't noticed weight loss but my intense love affair with food has waned.  I still like to eat, but its no longer my drug of choice ;).  Very pleased with Wellbutrin. I hope it lasts!

55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$This drug is doing a great job for me. I have been on it for 12 years. I originally took 150mg once a day; moved up to twice a day but switched to 300mg slow release so I wouldn't forget to take one of the doses. I tried so many different drugs over the past 20 years that I've lost count and the side affects were often horrific. Once my psychologist recommended Wellbutrin and my psychiatrist concurred I have never switched and it is the only anti-depressant I take. I also dropped 20 lbs of the 30 the other drugs had caused me to gain. It has helped with ADD
column3: SAD and the all encompassing symptoms of depression. There have been a few times during the years when I was unable to take it for several days in a row and you could tell but just one dose and I was back up feeling great. I'm sorry it doesn't work for everyone; it has so few uncomfortable side affects when compared to some of the newer drugs. But for those who have found relief I can tell you that after all these years I still have found relief. (My husband calls them my happy pills!)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Started these about 2 years ago after being  desperate because none of those that act on serotonin had worked for me. Best thing I ever did! I researched it on-line and found the ratio of people praising it to hating it was much more favourable than most other anti-depressants. Problem: I'm in the UK and it is only licensed for giving up smoking. So I have to order it from Europe or USA. I started by taking just a quarter of one 150mg tab and working up to the full dose by day 7. (different for everyone of course)

column1: Doing it this way made it much easier on the side-effects which for me were itchy rash on my hand and foot and difficulty getting to sleep maybe a bit of nausea but I found if I  ate some food with them it helped -even though my research said it shouldn't affect. I have read that taking a quarter of a tablet and building up gradually to lessen side-effects doesn't work. It really does for me. Bupropion has made me feel completely ""normal"" I didn't feel like I was on medication at all
column2: until recently. After about a year and half I found I got occasional head pains. Not a headache as such. If I lay down on my front suddenly to watch television or something like that i would get a sharp pressure-like pain. I would keep still or slowly sit up and it would pass. after a few months I gradually started to get a slight hang-over feeling for a few hours most days. without any changes to my diet etc. I don't normally get headaches. My delivery was very delayed recently and I literally ran out. I was very worried what would happen with suddenly stopping (i could not get any from the doctor of course) Nothing happened so I stayed off them for two months. I can now very slightly feel anxiety on waking up that I used to get but only slightly so I decided to start again rather than wait until it gets bad. Today is the first day and I have a bit of that slight tightness in the head feeling. Anyone else had similar?"

298$Condition: Depression$3/2/2011 3:43:33 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$"I just started taking this drug today
column2: and after reading the reviews I am concerned about the generic version I was given (Bupropion XL
column3: I think). According to one article
column4: it's the patented membrane that allows for extended release that seems to be the problem. Apparently some generics don't use the same XR method
column5: which can lead to a huge release of the active ingredient followed by little to no release. Wellbutrin has a membrane-like wall that allows a constant release
column6: but many generics use pills that just dissolve slowly. Other bodily functions can speed up or slow down the release (i.e.
column7: amount of food in stomach). Just thought this was interesting so I'm passing it along and will also ask my doctor about it.  http://www.prevention.com/health/health/healthy-l iving/find-out-how-to-use-generic-drugs-safely/ar ticle/ca929d93636d6110VgnVCM10000013281eac____

344$Condition: Depression$10/21/2010 8:29:38 PM$Reviewer: medwisegirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin has been great for me. All I wanted to do before taking this was sleep, and when I was up I was grouchy and irritated. I actually like getting up in the morning and enjoy my day. Everyone around me is much happier as well. I tried Cymbalta first and it didn't fit my specific needs, and in fact worsened my depression. There are different medicines for different types of depression. Wellbutrin works on the neurotransmitter dopamine. Dopamine is for motivation and acivating the reward center in the brain. I wouldn't discourage or encourage the use of this drug. It's your doctors job, depending on your depression symptoms, to match you with the best medicine for you. You need not listen to people that say not to try it, everyone is different. This medicine may or may not work for you. Treating depression is not an exact science, due to our lack of knowledge about the brain. Finding the right depression medicine will take trial and error, which can be very frustrating. Stick with it and you will find a medicine that works for you.

column5: and talk about them. Wellbutrin by itself is a great help
column6: but by far the most effective treatment for me has been talk therapy. Depression runs in the family. I did not start seeking treatment until age 27 when it became overwhelming  and was affecting my work and relationships. The first course of treatment my physician prescribed were SSRIs (Paxil
column7: Prozac and Zoloft)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin was a life saver for me. I was diagnosed with Major Depression 5 years ago and initially was prescribed Celexa. I felt a little better but still had no concentration or energy. My psychiatrist added Wellbutrin XL and it turned out to be the answer I needed. I would not have survived my depression without the addition of Wellbutrin to my celexa (300mg Wellbutrin and 40 mg Celexa). I know some people have shared negative side effects of this drug but you will not know unless you try it. It worked well for me but it is not for everyone. If you have depression please do not give up on finding the right medication for you. It just takes some time. I have been on meds and in individual therapy and it has been successful  in treating my depression. I am now to the point where I am titrating my Wellbutrin so that I can be med free and start a family. Thank you Wellbutrin for giving me my life back!

I would definitely recommend the extended version of this drug.  In the past I had taken zoloft and I did feel great.  A little too great.  I gained 30 lbs over 6 months and had NO libido.  And I couldn't sleep at night to boot!  I did love how I felt
column3: but I had to sleep and I didn't want to take a medication to sleep every night on top of the zoloft. column1: 529$Condition: Depression$10/2/2009 9:33:06 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I had suffered from depression for years before I started taking Wellbutrin. Word of caution on the generic version of Wellbutrin 300 XL - I tried it when it was approved and found after a few months that I was becoming depressed again. For me it seemed like instead of medication being steadily administered to my system throughout the day it hit all at once

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have suffered from depression most of my life.  In my early 20âs I started see a psychiatrist.  I received talk therapy as well as antidepressantsâ throughout my life.  I have been off & on Prozac for the past 20 years.  For nearly two years
column3: I have had trouble with sleeping too much (anywhere from 12 to 20 hours a night).  When I saw my regular doctor
column4: she suggested increasing my Prozac to 40mg & said I should expect to stay on it for the rest of my life (I am 63).  With no improvement she added Effexor (75mg).  It didnât seem to improve the sleeping or depression.  Besides the excessive sleeping
column5: I also felt like crying all the time; found no joy in life; had no energy; & no motivation to do anything (other than what was absolutely necessary ).  I went to a psychiatrist  and he decreased the Effexor  (37.5mg).  With still no improvement
column6: he stopped the Effexor and started me on Wellbutrin (300mg).  Within about three weeks I felt like a ânormalâ person.  I would wake before the alarm would ring
column7: had more energy and felt not so hopeless. I hadnât felt like this in a long time.  The change lasted about two months.   After he wrote the next prescription for Budeprion XL (300mg)
column8: which he said was cheaper.  I started to feel like I was going back to my old pattern of sleeping too much (not as bad as before but still too much) and not as much energy as with Wellbutrin..  I am sad to say I did not experience any weight loss with either the Wellbutrin or the generic.  While taking the generic
column9: I had some adverse effects which include: dry mouth; tremors of the hands; increase in resting heart rate (85+ per minute); trouble keeping my balance and some hair loss.  When I see the psychiatrist in a month

column11: not the generic.  It is worth the extra money.

35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been on Wellbutrin for about 10 months.  In December I began taking the 300mg XL version.  It helped me tremendously.  I had so much energy and motivation to do things.  It was a generic.  In March I had to switch my pharmacy so they gave me a different generic.  It was made by Watson.  I started getting really tired all the time.  I was constantly angry with people for no good reason and also seemed to be obbsessive compulsive.  There were also many physical side effects also.  I finally realized it was the medicine and stopped it immediately.  I began feeling so much better within 24 hours.  I can't believe the difference in these generics.  Please pay close attention to how you begin feeling when you take these.  I seriously think I would have become suicidal if I had not quit and I have never felt that way before.  If it's not working for you go to your doctor and try something else because these medicines can really change your entire personality.

45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am taking Wellbutrin SR. This stuff is so good they should put it in the water supply! I have energy
column3: my spastic boss does not get me annoyed anymore. I am calm
column4: I can deal with life's little problems much easier now. Have only been taking it for about a month. A little dry mouth is well worth it!! I have lost 16 pounds since I started taking it. No desire to drink any alcohol even a glass of wine tastes terrible now.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on wellbutrin for 15 years-I came off of it for a short time but the anxiety caused me to return to it again. Like most depression sufferers I have tried many drugs over the years but this one has the least side effects and works great. I occasionally get dry mouth so you do need to stay hydrated.  I was a smoker and a drinker and have kicked both habits as the drug really does reduce cravings for any pleasure. Unfortunately that does include sex as well-it does decrease your libido but that can be overcome if you work at it! It does not decrease the pleasure level but the desire to get started just isn't there. I did have a period of time where I was not eating as it does also take away your cravings for food. My hubby loves to eat so he makes me eat too
column3: so I have not had anorexia since I met him but I did with my first husband. So I would say that an understanding mate goes a long way toward helping to make this drug a success. I take 150 sr upon waking and before bed. My insurer is also pushing the generic but that did not work for me. I understand there are some generics that are better than others and if the cost is a factor you could try those first. I am convinced that wellbutin treats alcoholism because it runs in my family and I was a problem drinker until I took wellbutrin. I can have a drink now and not want another-but that may just be me. It is sure worth a try if you drink too much-I don't know why it is not more widely used for treating alcoholism because it works. You do have to take wellbutrin for 60 to 90 days to get the full effect of the drug.During that time you do have dry mouth but that subsides after a while and was not a significant problem for me. I am 62 years old so I don't know how much longer I will take it but the doctors seem to think that it is a lifelong drug. It has made a drastic change in my life and I recomend it highly!!

I also immediately quit smoking...have tried quitting many times before with no success. I started getting bad cramps and realized I was horribly constipated.  Tried upping my fiber and fluid intakes but nothing helped.  I had to stop taking it because of this...BUMMER.  I really liked this med and wish I could continue but I can't take laxative everyday to conteract the constipation!!!!!!!  Some decrease in sexual desire did occur.  My doc prescribed me Effexor XR and I filled the ordered but I do not think I will try this one because of the horrible things I have been reading about it.  I will be asking her about Cymbalta because the reviews seem much more positive.  I wish the makers of Wellbutrin/Bupripion could fix the constipation issue because it worked great for me!

681$Condition: Depression$2/24/2009 8:24:38 PM$Reviewer: ABMN, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$In Dec 2007 I was prescribed Wellbutrin 150mg, after the initial few weeks it just didn't seem to be working. My doctor bumped me up the the XL. It started working almost immediately. It felt as if the veil and earmuffs had been removed and colors and sounds became real again. I was extremely happy with the 50 lbs I lost. Sex drive came back with a vengeance. No listed side effects. It is now Feb 2009 and it doesn't seem to be working anymore; back to being irritable, short tempered and just sad. Going to Dr in 2 days to see if something else will work. One side effect that I can't find anyone else having is it messed with my period, even on birth control. My period would come whenever it wanted regardless of what week of pills I was on. Once I switched to taking the BCP at night and Wellbutrin XL in the a.m. it seemed to get MUCH better. Now that the wellbutrin isn't working as great, my cycle is completely whacked. Usually one week w/o it, then get it for a few days, then another week w/o, etc. Doctors say it has nothing to do with each other but I have been on the same BCP for almost 6 years and it didn't happen until I started taking the Wellbutrin XL.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$3$"     -Generic Brand vs. Name Brand Wellbutrin XL-

column1: I've been on Wellbutrin for (about) a year and MUST comment on the effects of the generic brand
column2: Bupropion (Sp?).
I spent a while on the generic version and failed to progress out of my depressive state. For a few weeks I felt like I was mildly feeling a change
column3: but eventually it felt like I had plateaued
column4: and shortly after
column5: I returned to spiraling downward.

column1: There were other medications added and subtracted to Wellbutrin in order to determine the right combination of drugs to aid my depression/anxiety/ADD. I AM POSITIVE that my only improvement was the result of other medications (Lamictal- mood stabilizer).
It has been documented that the generic version of this drug does NOT produce the same progressive results as the name brand. I can confidently say
column2: that my experience w/ Bupropion was not a good one
column3: in fact
column4: I'd say it was horrible
column5: and at times
column6: worse than my initial state.

column1: I have been back to taking the name brand Wellbutrin XL for about 3-4 months. I have continued to feel a drastic improvement in my mental state
column2: and finally recognize the person that I knew I always was. It has enabled me to live my life again.

column5: and very few insurance companies offer reasonable coverage for Wellbutrin XL
column6: since the generic version was approved."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$1$5$"If there is anyone who knows this drug it's me. I've been on it since it was created. column8: periodic insomnia

column10: just intensified by the drug). I feel like a Rx junkie
column11: getting low on this drug causes me to panic. I have hoarded it for ins. changes. You win GSK- you now own me. I hope you're happy and proud of yourself. Despite choosing to be happy and not wanting to rely on a chemical to make that be
column12: I no longer can. Perhaps I'm being too harsh on GSK and I truly have a chemical imbalance that will always need to be corrected??? Could be. I have developed a love/hate relationship with it at this point in my life. I love to take it and fell good and I hate to take it and feel weak for needing it. Straight up depression just blows. Too indescribable to an outsider about how it actually feels. "
